content: Thanks for the info. I figured that out after struggling for a while scratching my head. Do I need to leave cookies enabled after the configuration step? I'd like to not have third-party cookies enabled just because.
creator: joesabin

content: The cookie error is for the cookies in TB, not your web browser. Cookies must be accepted in TB Settings/Privacy & Security for OAuth2 authentication to complete and store a token in Saved Passwords.
creator: sfhowes

content:
The only process for that is the following steps: Exit Thunderbird if running. 

   click windows key and 'r' key    Enter: thunderbird.exe -P --allow-downgrade    click on 'OK'

Since this has been going on for two months, and nothing seems to work, my suggestion is to start over, with these possible steps: - in windows file explorer, copy the addressbook (abook.sqlite) and any messsage folders, such as Mail\POPaccount folders and Mail\Local folders - then copy the full profile somewhere for safekeeping - uninstall TB and reinstall. - setup accounts. for POP accounts, omit the password to ensure it doesn't start retrieving messages - exit TB and in windows file explorer, copy the backed up message folders to overlay the same locations as in original.
creator: davidsk

content: I am wondering about this too. On one of the machines I have, I thought that I had set it to only notify me, not upgrade automatically, but I'm not 100% certain, and it did regrade (I refuse to call it an upgrade!) to 115.3 without asking me. I double-checked a much more critical machine and it is still at 102 with auto turned off, so on that machine it's still safe. But I'm a little worried. I wonder if the push is a bit too hard.

creator: sfhowes

content: Possible alternative: instead of making a filter that has multiple From entries with each one a different address, consider storing those addresses in a separate address book, AB, and then setting the From rule to 'is in my address book' and pointing to AB. Then, to add a new sender to the filter, click the sender in the message header, twice, to add the sender to AB.
creator: sfhowes

content: There is no official procedure to revert to a prior version. My suggestion is to first post what difficulties you are experiencing to see if we can assist you. The prior version will never be update again, and I think you will be better served by staying with 115.

content:
Ciao, anzitutto è bene chiarire che support.mozilla.org non è un sito di supporto tecnico gestito direttamente da Mozilla ma un'area di discussione a disposizione di utenti e volontari. Venendo alla tua domanda: con opportune impostazioni l'aspetto di Thunderbird 115 non è poi così diverso da quello delle versioni precedenti e secondo me varrebbe comunque la pensa provare ad abituarsi visto che questa strada di design verrà seguita anche nel prossimo futuro.

Se proprio non riesci ad adattarti, qui puoi scaricare la vecchia versione 102 -> https://archive.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/102.15.1/ scegli prima il tuo sistema operativo, poi la lingua italiana (it) ed infine scarica il programma di installazione.

Fatto questo:

  1. Fai un backup del tuo profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo
  2. Installa la vecchia versione sopra quella nuova e se ricevi errori segui queste procedure a) https://gioxx.org/2021/08/04/impossibile-utilizzare-il-profilo-avviando-una-versione-precedente-di-thunderbird/ b) https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-dedicati-installazione-thunderbird#w_cosa-succede-a-un-profilo-se-si-retrocede-thunderbird-a-una-versione-precedente
creator: @next

content:
The people who answer questions here, for the most part, are other users volunteering their time (like me), not Thunderbird employees or developers.

As fellow users, we know exactly what you tell us and your recent post simply offers insufficient information about your setup and any error message that might be presented when you attempt to get mail for anyone to offer a meaningful response to your issue.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
If you feel not savvy enough to use the update, then it's unlikely to be a good experience attempting the steps to go back to the old version.

You can make the update look more like the old version, just like you can make the update look even newer than the default you are seeing.

There really isn't anything in the new interface that should be unfamiliar. What is it exactly that has you stumped?
creator: wsmwk

content: Nothing in that error console screen capture is related to SMTP or outgoing mail. The only thing I see related to mail is an error in a pop connection attempt where it is refused due to a network error. I also see a number of lines related to the OWL addon. If you issue is related to an account which is managed with OWL, you will need to address the issues with the addon vendor.

content:
I really do not know what happened here, but something totally bizarre. That install is for V78 first offered to channel users on July 17, 2020 and subsequently replaced by a number of stable releases in the ensuing years. I would expect an update at this time to be to version 115.

Mozilla Thunderbird Installation Started: 2023-10-01 22:45:52

​

Installation Details 

 Install Dir: C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Thunderbird  Locale     : en-GB  App Version: 78.6.0  GRE Version: 78.6.0  OS Name    : Windows 10  Target CPU : x86

So I guess you are trying to open and old version. Try downloading Thunderbird again from Thunderbird.net and running the installer. You will not get that message afterwards unless you previously were using a beta or daily developer build. If you do we can fix that as well.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: https://pastebin.mozilla.org/xUPNPNw8
creator: norbert.obrien

content:
use Mozilla's pastebin service to post the log.

  1. Go to https://pastebin.mozilla.org/, paste the clipboard by right clicking in the large text area, select paste from the menu, change the retention period to expire in 28 days, use the Paste Snippet button to create a page containing your info, then copy the resulting URL (address) of the page created.
  2. Open a reply to this post, and paste the URL to your troubleshooting information you just copied.
creator: MattAuSupport
